intro: Stellularia media var. calycina, commonly known as the calycine starwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of eastern North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its leaves are grass-like and arranged in a dense, clump-forming structure. The flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, which are characteristic of the sedge family.
